TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCScheduler extends System.Object

summary.para: is responsible for triggering the scheduled callbacks. You should not use NSTimer. Instead use this class.

remarks.para: There are 2 different types of callbacks (selectors):
The 'custom selectors' should be avoided when possible. It is faster, and consumes less memory to use the 'update selector'.

item.description: update selector: the 'update' selector will be called every frame. You can customize the priority.

remarks.description: update selector: the 'update' selector will be called every frame. You can customize the priority.

item.description: custom selector: A custom selector will be called every frame, or with a custom interval of time

remarks.description: custom selector: A custom selector will be called every frame, or with a custom interval of time

Docs.summary: Returns whether or not the target is paused v1.0.0

Docs.summary: Pause all selectors from all targets. You should NEVER call this method, unless you know what you are doing. v2.0.0

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.List<Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol> PauseAllTargetsWithMinPriority (int minPriority);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.List`1<class Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol> PauseAllTargetsWithMinPriority(int32 minPriority) cil managed

Docs.summary: Pause all selectors from all targets with a minimum priority. You should only call this with kPriorityNonSystemMin or higher. v2.0.0

MemberSignature.Value: public void PauseTarget (Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol target);
.method public hidebysig instance void PauseTarget(class Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol target) cil managed

Docs.summary: Pauses the target. All scheduled selectors/update for a given target won't be 'ticked' until the target is resumed. If the target is not present, nothing happens. v0.99.3

MemberSignature.Value: public void ResumeTarget (Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol target);
.method public hidebysig instance void ResumeTarget(class Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol target) cil managed

Docs.summary: Resumes the target. The 'target' will be unpaused, so all schedule selectors/update will be 'ticked' again. If the target is not present, nothing happens. v0.99.3

MemberSignature.Value: public void ResumeTargets (System.Collections.Generic.List<Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol> targetsToResume);
.method public hidebysig instance void ResumeTargets(class System.Collections.Generic.List`1<class Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol> targetsToResume) cil managed

Docs.summary: Resume selectors on a set of targets. This can be useful for undoing a call to pauseAllSelectors. v2.0.0

MemberSignature.Value: public void ScheduleSelector (Action<float> selector, Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol target, float interval, uint repeat, float delay, bool paused);

.method public hidebysig instance void ScheduleSelector(class System.Action`1<float32> selector, class Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol target, float32 interval, unsigned int32 repeat, float32 delay, bool paused) cil managed

Docs.summary: calls scheduleSelector with kRepeatForever and a 0 delay

MemberSignature.Value: public void ScheduleUpdateForTarget (Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol targt, int priority, bool paused);
.method public hidebysig instance void ScheduleUpdateForTarget(class Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol targt, int32 priority, bool paused) cil managed

Docs.summary: Schedules the 'update' selector for a given target with a given priority. The 'update' selector will be called every frame. The lower the priority, the earlier it is called. v0.99.3

MemberSignature.Value: public float TimeScale;
.field public float32 TimeScale

Docs.summary: Modifies the time of all scheduled callbacks. You can use this property to create a 'slow motion' or 'fast forward' effect. Default is 1.0. To create a 'slow motion' effect, use values below 1.0. To create a 'fast forward' effect, use values higher than 1.0. v0.8 It will affect EVERY scheduled selector / action.

MemberSignature.Value: public void UnscheduleAll ();
.method public hidebysig instance void UnscheduleAll() cil managed

Docs.summary: Unschedules all selectors from all targets. You should NEVER call this method, unless you know what you are doing.

remarks.para: Unschedules all selectors from all targets. You should NEVER call this method, unless you know what you are doing.

MemberSignature.Value: public void UnscheduleAllForTarget (Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol target);
.method public hidebysig instance void UnscheduleAllForTarget(class Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol target) cil managed

Docs.summary: Unschedules all selectors for a given target. This also includes the "update" selector. v0.99.3

Docs.summary: Unschedules all selectors from all targets with a minimum priority. You should only call this with kPriorityNonSystemMin or higher. v2.0.0

.method public hidebysig instance void UnscheduleSelector(class System.Action`1<float32> selector, class Cocos2D.ICCSelectorProtocol target) cil managed

Docs.summary: Unschedule a selector for a given target. If you want to unschedule the "update", use unscheudleUpdateForTarget. v0.99.3
